Throws:
InvalidDataException - validation errors

validateEdits

protected Transfer validateEdits()
                          throws InvalidDataException
Validates the Transfer header detail record containing the edits.

This method will perform validations common to all Transfer types. The the manifest number and the pro bill must be a number and cannot be longer than 9 ditis. The shipped date must be in the format of "mmddyyyy" and must be a vaild date.

Store Initiated (SI) transfers require a specific set of validations regarding the To-Store number. The To Store number 1) cannot be changed to 22 when it originally equals something else, 2) cannot be changed when it originally equals 22, and 3) must be checked against the database when the store number has been leagally changed.

Returns:
an instance of Transfer containing the validated transfer header data.
Throws:
InvalidDataException -
  1. The manifest number does not have a value, not numeric, or exceeds 9 digits.
  2. The pro bill does not have a value, not numeric, or exceeds 9 digits.
  3. The transfer date is invalid.
  4. For SI type transfers, the To-Store value entered
    • is null or blank,
    • is not numeric,
    • exceeds 5 digits,
    • differs from its oiginal value of 22,
    • equals 22 when its original value was something other than 22,
    • does not exists.

processData

public java.lang.Object processData(java.lang.Object data)
                             throws LaunchPadException
Updates the header details of a Transfer record.

Parameters:
data - an instance of Transfer containing the header data to be applied to the database as an update.
Returns:
an instance of the updated Transfer
Throws:
LaunchPadException - general database errors.

getModifiedModel

Returns:

windowOpened

public void windowOpened(java.awt.event.WindowEvent e)
Disallows the user from editing a BI Transfer with a status of Available, Detail Recevied, and Summary Received in which their codes are, "A", "B", or "R", respectively.

When one of these codes are encounterd, an appropriate message is displayed to the user in the form of a popup window. Next, the CommonTransferHeaderDialog window is closed and control is returned to the caller. Otherwise, the user is allowed to edit the transfer header record.

Specified by:
windowOpened in interface java.awt.event.WindowListener
Overrides:
windowOpened in class AbstractModalWindow
Parameters:
e - an instance of WindowEvent
See Also:
AbstractModalWindow.windowOpened(java.awt.event.WindowEvent)
